intro: Elaphoglossum mcvaughii, commonly known as the McVaugh's holly fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, leathery fronds that are typically dark green with a glossy texture. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil to flourish. Its spores are released from the undersides of its fronds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
